intro: Ranunculus ramulosus, commonly known as the clustered buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are palmately lobed and bright yellow flowers with five petals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
